metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7407 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The ourWriteOut function in tool_writeout.c in curl 7.53.1 might allow physically proximate attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory in opportunistic circumstances by reading a workstation screen during use of a --write-out argument ending in a '%' character, which leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.11
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.11
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.11
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Affected code is in src/writeout.c in older releases mdeslaur> first commit is in 7.52.1-4, second one isn't

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.11').
